en.purpose: To calculate and interpret the body mass index.
en.use: The interpretation should be used for patients 18 years of age and older and for populations other than Asian and South Asian. Fill in all the input fields to calculate the score and obtain an interpretation.
en.misuse: In certain populations, like elite athletes and body-builders, an elevated BMI does not directly correlate to their health status due to their increased muscle mass and weight falsely increasing their BMI.

gt0001.description:
Body mass index (BMI) is a simple index of weight-for-height that is commonly used to classify overweight and obesity in adults. It is defined as a person's weight in kilograms divided by the square of his height in meters (kg/m2).

Frame of reference as defined by the World Health Organization (WHO):
Below 18,5 - underweight,
18,5-24,9 - normal weight,
25,0-29,9 - pre-obesity,
30,0-34,9 - obesity class I,
35,0 - 39,9 - obesity class II,
Above 40,0 - obesity class III
